content:
The hardest part of sports betting isn't picking winners.

It's:
→ Managing bankroll
→ Controlling emotion
→ Staying disciplined

Most people get the picks right. Then bet too much and blow up.

Math is easy. Psychology is hard.

RT if variance has destroyed you this month:

The best part of building your own thing:

No meetings about meetings.
No politics.
No BS.

Just build. Ship. Learn. Repeat.

That's worth the risk.

When's your last pivot? How long did it take?
